tasks.text: Secure laundry room door with door locks.
Secure drawers or cabinets that contain hazardous products with locks.
Activate child lock feature on washer's control panel.

tips.text: This prevents the door from opening mid-cycle.

tasks.text: Limit space on the sides of the washer and dryer.

tips.text: This prevents your child from crawling behind the machines.

tasks.text: Purchase a crib with fixed sides, narrow slats, and no corner posts. If using a glider, purchase one with a stop-lock mechanism.

tips.text: Drop-sided cribs pose a threat to infants, many of whom have been injured or killed as a result of hardware malfunctions common to the crib's design.
Slats should be no further than 2 and 3/8th inches apart.
Clothing may become caught on posts, resulting in strangulation.
A glider with a stop-lock mechanism prevents the glider from moving when not in use.

tasks.text: Ensure the crib mattress is firm and well-fitting.

tips.text: There should be no more than two fingers of space between the side of the mattress and the crib frame; any larger and your baby may become entrapped between the two, resulting in injury or suffocation.

tasks.text: Remove soft toys and bedding from crib. Leave only a thin mattress and fitted sheet.

tips.text: Blankets, pillows, and bumpers of any kind pose a risk of suffocation and or entrapment and should never be used in a crib.

tasks.text: Once baby can sit up, remove hanging mobiles from crib.
Move crib away from anything that could be used for climbing.
Ensure crib is not next to a heater or an area with direct sunlight.

tips.text: Both are risk factors for SIDS.

tasks.text: Install window guards.

tips.text: While window guards provide reassurance, they are not a substitute for parental supervision.

tasks.text: Store tools out of reach and don't allow electrical cords to dangle.
Put toxic substances in locked storage.
Store buckets upside down to prevent liquid accumulation.
Keep recycling and garbage containers closed and locked.
Install lock on the door connecting the house to the garage.
Install lock on any entryways leading to the basement.
Make sure the garage door has a safety sensor.
Secure cabinets with cabinet locks.

tips.text: Put safety guards on any cabinet or drawer that contains medicine or any other hazardous items.

tasks.text: Ensure medications are out of reach and secured with childproof tops.
Secure toilet with toilet locks.

tips.text: Put safety guards on toilets to make sure that your child cannot get in them.

tasks.text: Install a spout cover in the bathtub.

tips.text: Note: bathtub spouts are the third most common cause of stitches in babies.

tasks.text: Put non-slip mats in and beside the bathtub.
Have a plumber install an anti-scald device for the faucets and shower head.

tips.text: Regulate the water temperature to help prevent burns.

tasks.text: Reduce water heater settings to 120 degrees Farenheit.
Install a stable shower curtain rod.
Install covers for stove and oven knobs.

tips.text: This prevents your child from turning on the stove or oven accidentally.

tasks.text: Install an appliance latch for the oven door.

tips.text: This prevents your child from opening a potentially hot oven.

tasks.text: Install stove guard to block access to burners.

tips.text: A barrier keeps your child's small hands away from burners.

tasks.text: Always keep pot handles turned toward wall while cooking.
Always keep hot food and drinks away from table edge.
When possible, cook using only back burners.
Install safety latches on refrigerator and freezer doors.
Remove magnets from the refrigerator.

tips.text: Magnets are a choking hazard.

tasks.text: Install a safety cover on the garbage disposal.
Do not use placemats or tablecloths.

tips.text: This prevents your child from yanking loose cloth and having items fall on them.

tasks.text: Attach safety latches and locks.

tips.text: Secure any drawers containing knives, scissors, or sharp utensils.
Keep kids out of any cabinets that contain household cleaners.

tasks.text: Install foam bumpers on the fireplace hearth and mantles.
Secure heavy furniture to walls.
Secure the television to the wall, or place the television on tall sturdy furniture.
Remove floor lamps.
Block access to all floor heaters and radiators.
Install fireplace screen around fireplace.
Install bumpers to sharp corners on furniture.
Move all electric cords behind furniture or under rugs.
Latch cupboards, doors, and drawers within baby's reach.
Purchase baby-safe doorstops.
Place baby gates at the top and bottom of every set of stairs.
Install plexiglass on stair and balcony rail spaces greater than four inches.
Ensure backyard gates latch securely.
Make a kid-free zone.

tips.text: Prevent your child from entering the grilling area, as well as any structure or shed that might contain tools, lawn mowers, etc.

tasks.text: Ensure ground cover is soft (grass or rubber), and avoid pea gravel at all costs.

tips.text: Pea gravel is a choking hazard.

tasks.text: Avoid dangerous plants.

tips.text: This includes plants that are toxic (mushrooms), prickly (rose, bougainvillea), and bear fruits (berries).

tasks.text: Ensure fertilizers and insecticides are safe during and after application.
Store garden hoses out of the sun.

tips.text: Water remaining in the hose can scald the child.

tasks.text: Empty wading pools and store upright after each use.
Install a locked fence around permanent pool structures.

tips.text: Ensure that the gate to the pool has a lock that prevents your child from entering alone but can be opened quickly by an adult in case of an emergency.
Don't let water accumulate on the top of the pool cover - that's a drowning hazard!

tasks.text: Install tall flags on riding toys and ensure riding area is safe.
Cut window-blind cords.

tips.text: Alternatively, use safety tassels and inner cord stops so that your child cannot get entagled.

tasks.text: Place covers over unused outlets.

tips.text: Sliding covers are the best as the push-in ones can be pulled out and possibly choked on.

tasks.text: Install hardware-mounted safety gates in front of any stairs in the house.
Install corner and edge bumpers.

tips.text: These will help prevent injuries from falls against sharp edges.

tasks.text: Use doorstops and door holders.

tips.text: This prevents your child's small fingers from being crushed or pinched in doors and door hinges.

tasks.text: Ensure all cords are off the floor.

tips.text: Your child can get tangled in any cords.
